ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime
1= depression; 2= cardiac; 3= derealization; 4= social; 5= depression/hostility; 6= hostility; 7= safety; 8= health; 9= daily stress; 10= vision; 11= generalized anxiety; 12= health safety
1= NA, no response until timeout; 2= pointerup-mouse, mouse/trackpad click; 3= pointerup-touch, touchscreen touch

ElementDescription: Percentage of all responses with positive or neutral valence (%)
Average reaction time of responses to all trials (ms)
Standard deviation of reaction times of responses to all trials (ms)
Percentage of all responses with positive or neutral valence (%)
Average reaction time of responses with positive or neutral valence (ms)
Standard deviation of reaction times of responses with positive or neutral valence (ms)
Percentage of all responses with negative valence (%)
Average reaction time of responses with negative valence (ms)
Standard deviation of reaction times of responses with negative valence (ms)

Notes: CogBias.Main.v1.Oct20 = baseline version; CogBias.EMA.v1.Aug21 = ema version
